subject: RE: [junit] JavaDocs
msgSnippet: If you keep the src and test tree s seperated (but same packages) it becomes very easy, just tell the javadoc to create the docs from the src dir. ... This
messageBody:
If you keep the src and test tree's seperated (but same packages) it becomes
very easy, just tell the javadoc to create the docs from the src dir.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: STRAYER, JON (AIT) [mailto:jon.strayer@...]
> Sent: 14 February 2002 15:22
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: [junit] JavaDocs
>
>
> Having decided to put the unit tests in classes named TestFoo
> (where Foo is
> the class being unit tested) how do I convince JavaDoc (or
> rather the Ant
> javadoc task) to not generate docs for the test classes?
>
